thread.title: Lady Gaga's 'Joanne' world tour to play Wrigley Field
thread.title_full: Lady Gaga's 'Joanne' world tour to play Wrigley Field | Chicago Sun-Times

author: Miriam Di Nunzio
title: Lady Gaga's 'Joanne' world tour to play Wrigley Field
text:
She delivered a glitzy 12-minute halftime show at Sunday night’s Super Bowl game at NRG Stadium in Houston. Hours after the game she teased via Twitter that she was prepping for a major world tour.
And today, the dates of her much-anticipated 2017 Joanne World Tour have been announced, including an Aug. 25 tour stop at Chicago’s Wrigley Field, making her the first female to headline the ballpark solo. Tickets go on sale at 10 a.m. Feb. 13 at livenation.com. There will be a ticket limit of 8 tickets per transaction for all first day sales.
Gaga most recently played the Chicago area when he co-headlined Ravinia with Tony Bennett in 2015. She also brought her Born this Way Tour to the United Center in 2014.
The tour is in support of her fifth and latest studio album “Joanne,” released in 2016, and named in honor of her late aunt Joanne Germanotta, who died from Lupus at the age of 19 (Joanne is also the name of the New York trattoria owned by Gaga’s parents)
Here are the dates of the Joanne World Tour:
Aug. 1: Rogers Arena, Vancouver, BC*
Aug. 3: Rogers Place, Edmonton, AB*
Aug. 5: Tacoma Dome, Tacoma, WA*
Aug. 8: The Forum, Los Angeles, CA*
